title: Intel CEO Sees Revenue Growth Gaining Pace Starting Next Year
sub_head: Pat Gelsinger expects Intel to be able to reach and sustain double-digit annual revenue increases and gain market share
body:
Intel Corp. Chief Executive Pat Gelsinger set a goal for the company to reach double-digit revenue growth in three to four years, as he detailed the financial ambitions of his turnaround plan for the semiconductor giant.
Mr. Gelsinger, now just over a year in the CEO role, on Thursday said top-line growth this year would be “moderate” and start to pick up next year. Around 2025 or 2026, sales should increase 10% to 12% a year and remain at a double-digit pace going forward.
